I’m having this weird issue where I’m getting `com.android.dex.DexIndexOverflowException: method ID not in [0, 0xffff]: 65536`

However, it only happens when trying to install on pre-lollipop devices, and it only happens when you try to install from android studio.  It works when building and installing from the command line, and I’m only about half way to the dex limit..
Has anyone else come across something like this?  Internet hasn’t been much help yet
This is called multiDex.
Count of methods is more than 65535, and their names can’t fit an a two-byte-indexed DEX dictionary.
You can shrink code or allow Gradle to produce two (or more) DEX files.
With the second option, you must also derive your Application class from MultiDexApplication from MultiDEX supoprt library.

Hey everyone! Genymotion guy here! Don't know if you're into Amazon Web Services, but we've just published the very first Android EC2 instances!

I believe the main strength of this is that you can build your own Android solution(s) on top of them (e.g. have a fully functional Android OS embedded into any website)

If you give it a try let me know. I'd be very happy to know what you think!
We're explaining everything in this medium post: <https://medium.com/@Genymotion/android-os-now-available-as-an-amazon-machine-image-72748130436b#.r7ew3x47v>

See you!

attachments.title: Android OS Now Available as an Amazon Machine Image :tada:
attachments.text: We’ve released the very first AWS EC2 instances for Android
attachments.fallback: Medium: Android OS Now Available as an Amazon Machine Image 🎉

And here's my today's contribution to the community. I wrote a small tool for configuring the Android System UI demo mode, for cleaning up the status bar (similar to the "Clean status bar" app you might know). It's open source on GitHub and I also wrote a blog post about it: <https://pspdfkit.com/blog/2016/clean-statusbar-with-systemui-and-quickdemo/> I hope you enjoy it!

attachments.title: A clean status bar with Android System UI and QuickDemo | Inside PSPDFKit
attachments.text: How to enable Android's demo mode using a quick setting tile

Does anyone here use RxJava2?
For 1.x, I can cancel an API call via `Subscription.unsubscribe()`
For 2.x, it seems to be change to `Disposable.dispose()`
But I got exception after calling `dispose()`
Here is my issue <https://github.com/ReactiveX/RxJava/issues/4863>
